wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Marshall Kennedy (15 December 1849 – 31 January 1906) was an English cricketer.  Kennedy was a right-handed batsman who fielded as a wicket-keeper.  He was born at Woodmancote, Sussex.
Kennedy made his first-class debut for Sussex against Gloucestershire in 1872.  He made twenty further first-class appearances for the county, the last of which came against Surrey in 1878.  In his 21 first-class matches for Sussex, he scored a total of 272 runs at an average of 8.00, with a high score of 37.  He also made two first-class appearances for the South against the North in 1875.He died at Tunbridge Wells, Kent, on 31 January 1906.

response: Charles Kennedy (1959–2015) was a Scottish politician and former leader of the UK Liberal Democrats.
Charles Kennedy may also refer to:
*Charles Kennedy (1947–2005), American comedian, better known as Charles Rocket
*Charles Kennedy, 5th Marquess of Ailsa (1875–1956), Scottish peer
*Charles Kennedy Scott (1876–1965), English organist and choral conductor
